title: What are truth conditional semantics? - Quora

response.answer_text: Truth conditional semantics is an approach to semantics that attempts to describe the conditions that must be true in the world for a sentence to be considered “true”. Usually, this involves explicating the meaning of an utterance using a set-theoretic model which represents some or all of the world, and describing its arrangement such that a sentence evaluates to 1. E.g. “John is a smoker” is true if and only if the individual John is a member of the set of people who habitually smoke in the evaluation world. Formally, [[John is a smoker]] = 1 iff John ∈ smokers in w
